page.title: 05Industry in Cheadle Hulme.
page.content: The distribution depot is on Stanley Road Industrial Estate.It stores the crisps and then distributes them all over the country and abroad.They are sent to the smallest newsagents and the largest supermarkets.On the staff are 15 office workers and 17 drivers. Though the major part of the business is crisps,they also make snacks such as peanuts.Most of the produce is sold under their own label but some is sold to the large supermarket chains who use their own names.In recent years the firm has been sponsoring football matches and other events to get advertising for their products.1984 has been a successful year for the crisp company,whose annual profit is Â£6,000,000.If advertising was not used, sales would go down by 33%.
